title: Jan 31: {P} Light-Head R-CNN: In Defense of Two-Stage Object DetectorÂ

cells.data:
## Overall thoughts
This paper came before Mask R-CNN. Surprising that Mask R-CNN did not reference this paper or use a lighter architecture in reference to this paper.

True innovation seems to be just a reduction in the complexity of the head, which is permitted because of the relative simplicity (bounding box, instead of instance segmentation) of the problem. Maybe that's why Mask R-CNN didn't use a lighter architecture like was done in this paper.

## Summary
Single-stage detector allows speed and "resonably good accuracy". 
Two-stage detector first focuses on the recognition of proposals, and usually involve a pretty heavy head to achieve good accuracy.
